articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits War Museum Nearing Completion
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits War Museum Nearing Completion
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum close to completion.
					 Going round different parts including the victorious Fatherland Liberation War memorial tower, exhibition of weapons which performed feats in the war, the victorious war museum, he acquainted himself in detail with the construction and historic data and exhibits on display.
					
					 He said that the gatepost, a symbol of the war museum, was successfully built and the war memorial tower erected in a peculiar style from the aspect of formative art.
					
					 He noted that the museum has now a vast open-air exhibition ground as it was built to the convenience of visitors and helps them know well about the exploits of the KPA and the defeat suffered by the enemy troops.
					
					 He went round the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum.
					
					 Looking round the main lobby of the museum to house a statue of President Kim Il Sung and several halls and rooms, data displayed on the corridor and walls, large semi-panorama, exhibits, works of art and photos, etc. he said that all spaces of the museum have turned into places for education. The party made a good decision to reconstruct the museum, he added.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that it has been successfully built as a war museum for conveying the exploits performed by the President in winning the last Fatherland Liberation War to posterity, a center for anti-Japanese, anti-U.S. and class education and a center for educating visitors in the tradition of victory.
					
					 He stressed that the museum is an eternal treasure of the Korean revolution as it will eternally glorify the rare military wisdom, outstanding military idea and enduring war feats of Kim Il Sung, the iron-willed commander who defeated the two imperialist formidable enemies in one century and defended the independence and sovereignty of the country and nation.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon and Ju To Hyon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of KPA
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), visited the Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of the KPA whose construction is close to completion. 
					 The cemetery located at the entrance of Ryonmot-dong, Pyongyang City, consists of gatepost, monument to proposition, monument to poem dedicated to the fallen fighters, memorial tower, wreath-laying stand, graves of fallen fighters, etc.
					
					 Before the gatepost, he said that the gatepost was built in a peculiar style, adding that the stone pillars depicting the fluttering party and national flags with figures "1950" and "1953" inscribed on them visually remind visitors that it is the cemetery of martyrs who laid down their lives during the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The fallen fighters of the KPA who performed feats in the war came to lead an eternal life under the care of the WPK and the DPRK, he stressed.
					
					 Going round the memorial tower in the center of the cemetery, he said it is good to have erected the tower by combining a rifle, a bayonet and the national flag as a single representation. The flag of the Republic seems to flutter, he added.
					
					 Standing before the area of the semi-circle cemetery where the remains of fallen fighters would be buried, he said there is the owner of every grave from olden times, adding that the WPK is the owner of the graves of known and unknown martyrs.
					
					 Looking at the monuments to proposition and poem, he underscored the need to inscribe well the propositions given by President Kim Il Sung and words honoring the fallen fighters.
					
					 After learning about the greening of the cemetery, he gave an instruction to create wider greenery in the education ground so as to increase the total space of the greenery.
					
					 He also learned about the information service conducted through visual aids for soldier-builders involved in the construction of the cemetery.
					
					 He underlined the need to spruce up the cemeteries of the martyrs in Pyongyang City as well as provincial seats across the country so that they may help school youth and children and people know well about the feats performed by the army and people during the war and mass heroism and patriotic spirit displayed by them.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon and Ju To Hyon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Construction Site of Apartment Houses for Scientists
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Construction Site of Apartment Houses for Scientists
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the construction site of apartment houses for scientists.
					 The houses now under construction in the suburbs of Pyongyang City in a peculiar style are the gifts to be presented by him to scientists.
					
					 Modern multi-storied houses for 1 000 families, public buildings and various welfare and service facilities are now under construction in this area.
					
					 Going round the construction site, he acquainted himself in detail with the progress made in the construction.
					
					 Feasting his eyes with satisfaction on the houses that have sprung up in the field like mushrooms, he said that the houses look very nice, adding that their splendid appearances prompt one to go inside them. He praised the soldier-builders for successfully constructing them as required by their designs.
					
					 To keep pace with the arrangement of environment is important in construction, he noted, underscoring the need to pay attention to land leveling and plant trees and create greenbelt, at the same time, in a planned manner so as to wind up the project, leaving no traces of construction.
					
					 After learning about the progress made in the construction of school, kindergarten, hospital and other public buildings and welfare and  service facilities, he called for focusing efforts on the structures nearing  completion and pushing ahead with the project as scheduled.
					
					 Watching the park under construction in the area, he said that people and school youth and children like to visit the rebuilt parks in Pyongyang. He called on the builders to build the park into a fashionable one so that the residential district for scientists may become a model in housing construction.
					
					 He went round the houses where there are flats for two families on one floor.
					
					 He once again highly appreciated the feats performed by the soldier-builders, saying that the houses were well designed and built at a high level.
					
					 It is a great success that such modern houses have been built in such a brief span of time, he noted, adding that it is necessary to surpass the speed of construction in the 1970s and that is the "Masikryong Speed" called for by the WPK. 
					
					 After being told that the soldier-builders are pushing forward the project as scheduled, though they take charge of the most difficult area, he said he is pleased to assign a task to the KPA. Whenever there arises a difficult task, he is used to visit the army and assign it to it, he added. 
					
					 Primary attention should be paid to ensuring quality in the construction, he said, calling for completing the houses in a perfect manner and providing them to scientists so that they may be fully satisfied with them, leaving nothing inconvenient.
					
					 This year is a year of scientists who demonstrated before the whole world the dignity and national power of the country with signal scientific and technological achievements, he said, stressing that there is nothing to spare for them who proved in practice the justice of the WPK's policy of attaching importance to science and technology.
					
					 He instructed the WPK Central Committee and the Cabinet to dispatch responsible officials to the spot to learn about the progress made in the construction and review daily, weekly and monthly fulfillment of quotas and take measures to ensure that no job is delayed.
					
					 Saying he would frequently visit the construction site to learn about the progress made in the construction, he noted the houses can be provided to the scientists only when their construction meets the requirements of the standard set by him.
					
					 He gave an instruction to successfully complete the houses to be proud of before the world by the Day of Songun when leader Kim Jong Il started his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon and Ju To Hyon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Soldier-Builders of Ski Resort on Masik Pass
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Soldier-Builders of Ski Resort on Masik Pass
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un sent gifts to soldier-builders who are performing heroic feats in the construction of the ski resort on Masik Pass.
					 He published a historic appeal in which he reposed profound trust in them by calling on them to unconditionally wind up the project within this year by creating the "Masikryong Speed", new a-match-for-a-hundred speed of charge in the 21st century. Later, he sent a lot of construction materials, foodstuff and daily necessities to the soldier-builders.
					
					 A meeting for conveying the gifts was held on spot on Monday.

articles.title: CPRK Accuses S. Korean Chief Executive of Her Anti-DPRK Remarks
articles.content:
CPRK Accuses S. Korean Chief Executive of Her Anti-DPRK Remarks
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) Monday gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards the provocative remarks made by the south Korean chief executive against the DPRK during her trip to China:
					 Park Geun Hye let loose a whole string of provocative remarks seriously hurting the dignity and social system in the DPRK while visiting China.
					
					 At the "summit talks," conversations, press conference and in a special lecture given at a university during her trip she persistently raised the "nuclear issue in the north", expressing "concern" and "disallowance." She went the lengths of blustering that the DPRK's new strategic line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force is "something impossible from the beginning" and "this only invites self-isolation."
					
					 Describing the DPRK's nukes as a threat to the peace in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia, she impertinently urged it to "dismantle nukes" and "turn itself into a responsible member of the international community" and implored China to help in the issue of "defectors from the north."
					
					 She made so desperate efforts to garner support for south Korea that her shamelessness and disgusting nature reached the height.
					
					 As for the nuclear issue, even a mere child knows that the issue was spawned by the U.S., and the nuclear threat to the Korean Peninsula is coming from the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 She kept mum about U.S. nukes for aggression despite the fact that it is the arch criminal who staged largest-ever madcap maneuvers for a nuclear war against the DPRK after bringing nuclear strategic means into south Korea. She, however, vociferated about "disallowance" and the like, taking issue with fellow countrymen's nuclear shield of justice. This reminds one of guilty party filing the suit first.
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that Park, defying repeated warnings of the DPRK, dared take issue again with the DPRK's new strategic line during her trip.
					
					 This is a blatant challenge to the dignity, social system and political line of the DPRK and an unpardonable grave provocation against it.
					
					 The DPRK's new line is the most independent and patriotic one for building a thriving nation to enable its people to fully lead wealth and luxury under socialism. Because it calls for bolstering up nuclear force and the  country's defence capability so as to provide a sure guarantee for the security and prosperity of the nation and direct greater efforts to economic construction.
					
					 Lurking behind the malignant accusations made by Park against the DPRK over its most just great line even in a foreign country is a sinister intention to persist in her moves to escalate confrontation and aggression, much upset by the DPRK's ever-increasing might and position and the failure of U.S. policy of a nuclear war.
					
					 She again cried out for "change" in the DPRK while talking about "new south-north relations" and "new Korean Peninsula", but it is the south Korean regime which has to be changed.
					
					 This is proved by the fact that the voices censuring the present regime for being worse than the Lee Myung Bak regime in confrontation with compatriots are growing stronger in south Korea.
					
					 In order to grab power the Park Geun Hye regime let the Intelligence Service interfere in the "presidential" election and even fully open to public the minutes of the inter-Korean summit to stay in power, an act which traitor Lee Myung Bak dared not to do, turning south Korea into a pandemonium and making its ruling system shake to its very foundation.
					
					 This being a hard fact, Park feigned ignorance of this. During her trip she uttered the word "confidence" whenever an opportunity presented itself, blaring "confidence is what she considered as most important while enforcing politics and she regarded diplomacy based on confidence as the cornerstone of diplomacy." This brings her brazen-faced nature to light.
					
					 Can the DPRK have dialogue based on confidence with such south Korean authorities in the future?
					
					 Talking about "confidence-building process on the Korean Peninsula", Park asserted south Korea would never allow the north's access to nukes under any circumstances and it would resolutely counter the "provocation" but would help the north if it dismantles its nukes and opts for change. This clearly indicates that the "confidence-building process" she spelled out as the "policy toward the north" is a dangerous confrontation policy little different from the watchword "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" put up by the Lee Myung Bak regime.
					
					 In a final analysis, her ulterior intention is to disarm the DPRK with the help of foreign forces and bring about a change in its social system through international cooperation. This is, however, nothing but a daydream.
					
					 During her recent trip, Park spoke of her compatriots so ill to embarrass others that she was advised to "have goodwill." 
					
					 Explicitly speaking once again, Park should clearly know that the DPRK's nukes, shield for justice and peace and treasure for the nation, can never be a bargaining chip in any case and they cannot be subject at a negotiating table no matter how vociferously the puppet group, war servants of the U.S., may talk about them.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never pardon those who pursue confrontation with fellow countrymen while daring hurt the dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK is following Park with last patience.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly want dialogue with the north and improved relations, they should stop such foolish behavior as sycophancy toward the U.S. and confrontation with compatriots and their demeanor inciting confrontation which does them nothing good but take a national stand.
					
					 This will be the only right option for inter-Korean relations and for themselves.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Somalia
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Somalia
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Hassan Sheikh Mohamed, president of Somalia, on its national day. 
					 Kim sincerely wished the president and people of Somalia success in their work for stability and development of the country, expressing belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Somalia would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Rwanda
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Rwanda
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Paul Kagame, president of Rwanda, on June 25 on the 51st anniversary of its independence, the national holiday of the Rwandan people.
					 The message sincerely wished the president and people of Rwanda greater successes in their efforts for national reconciliation and peace and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Rwanda would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Burundi
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Burundi
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Pierre Nkurunziza, president of Burundi, on June 25 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of its independence.
					 The message sincerely wished the Burundian president greater success in his responsible work for peace, stability and democratic development of the country, expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Burundi would grow stronger in line with the common interests and desires of the two peoples.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Visits Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Visits Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, made a field survey of the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex. 
					 Touring different places of the complex the premier spoke highly of the successes made by officials, technicians and workers of the complex who have replied to the Workers' Party of Korea's call with increased production of electricity before learning in detail about the production and boiler operation. 
					
					 Then he convened a consultative meeting to stress the need to produce much more electricity and send it to fields of national economy so as to meet the demand for electricity in building an economic power. He called for meticulously organizing the management of equipment and technical control and increasing production. 
					
					 The premier also went round the Miphyong Co-op Farm, Thongchon County, Kangwon Province. 
					
					 Learning about the manuring and cultivation of crops, he underscored the need to establish ring-shaped rotation production system to raise soil fertility, and radically increase grain production and thoroughly prevent crop and land damage by downpours. 
					
					 Earlier, the premier visited the Pyongyang Electrical Appliances Joint Venture Company to learn in detail about the researches into the power management and production of different kinds of watt-hour meters before holding a consultative meeting. 
					
					 The consultative meeting discussed and took measures to improve the power industry system to meet the higher demands for power in the fields of the national economy and use electricity in an effective manner.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Information Technology, Posts and Communications Authority of Mongolia led by Chairman Tsagaan-Uvgun Jadambaa visited the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Monday.
					 The delegation paid floral tribute to them. It arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Order of Soldier's Honor
articles.content:
Order of Soldier's Honor
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Order of Soldier's Honor (1st & 2nd classes) has been awarded to servicepersons in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea who render distinguished services on their military duties and in construction sites.
					 The order was instituted on the initiative and guidance of President Kim Il Sung soon after the outbreak of the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953). 
					
					 On June 28, Juche 39 (1950), Kim Il Sung told an official that he was going to award the Seoul unit title to those that participated in the Seoul liberation operation, adding citations also should be conferred on meritorious soldiers.
					
					 On that evening, he called an artist and gave him a task to design the order.
					
					 Next day, he examined the design, suggesting inscribing letters "For the fatherland" and a soldier with rifle in hands in the order and decorating its frame with red-color star.
					
					 He again examined the revised design the next day and approved it. He then personally named it Order of Soldier's Honor.
					
					 Thus, the order was instituted on July 1, 1950, six days after the outbreak of the war.

articles.title: Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show to Be Held
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show to Be Held 
						
Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- A Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show will be held here late in July to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					It will bring together horticulturists of armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions, the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and other overseas Koreans' organizations.
					
					The show will prove to be grand gardens of flowers presented by servicepersons and people of the DPRK with the best wishes for the immortality of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and a grand political festival praising and revering the great men who defeated the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces to win a victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and led the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle to one victory after another with their Juche-oriented military idea, outstanding strategic and tactics and rare art of command and developed the DPRK into an invincible nuclear weapons state. 
					
					Such flower shows will be also held in local areas and people there will visit Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia greenhouses in their residential areas.

articles.title: Korea Education Fund
articles.content:
Korea Education Fund
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Korea Education Fund (KEF) is going ahead with aiding activities for schools.
					 This year, KEF plans to direct efforts to the improvement of teachers' qualities and educational conditions and supply of athletic equipment.
					
					 Meanwhile the fund has stepped up cooperation with overseas Koreans and non-governmental organizations and donors of different countries.
					
					 Last year, it supplied to orphans and children in disaster-afflicted areas such aid materials as school things, clothes, footwear, food and medicines on nearly 50 installments. It also provided 77 schools with teaching and experimental apparatuses, renovated 15 schools and arranged 12 rounds of refresher courses for teachers.
					
					 Some 130 projects were implemented with over 190 schools becoming beneficiaries.
					
					 KEF established relations of cooperation with New Hope Foundation, Northeast Asia Foundation for Education and Culture and many other organizations and personages.
					
					 Ko Song Ryol, KEF secretary general, told KCNA that the fund would try to get more donors in implementing planned projects.
					
					 The 2012 annual report was issued some days ago.

articles.title: Composite Ceramic Tool Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Composite Ceramic Tool Developed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- A new kind of composite ceramic tool was developed jointly by Kim Chaek University of Technology and the Pyongyang Textile Machine Factory.
					 The tool is a cutting chip made with reinforcing agent, based on locally available materials, as additives.
					
					 It has been put into production, being widely applied to CNC lathes and other machines at different factories.
					
					 The new kind can be used 1.2 times longer than other kinds.

articles.title: Orchestral Music "Mungyong Pass"
articles.content:
Orchestral Music "Mungyong Pass"
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- An orchestral music "Mungyong Pass" was performed at the June 25 Concert of the Unhasu Orchestra, touching the heartstrings of audience.
					 The music is a reminder of the soldiers of the Korean People's Army who devotedly fought battles in the pass during the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953).
					
					 In July Juche 39 (1950), the soldiers went over a series of heights, fighting fierce battles against the enemy to advance southward.
					
					 When climbing up the pass early in August that year, President Kim Il Sung said that the pass was merely a route linking Kyonggi area to Ryongnam area, but it rose to fame for death-defying battles against the U.S. invaders. He further said that the heroic feats performed by the soldiers in the pass would remain forever in the hearts of the Korean people.
					
					 The song "Mungyong Pass" was written by Jo Ki Chon and composed by Ri Myon Sang in 1950. It was arranged as an orchestral music in 1971.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls on All Koreans to Turn Out in Actions for Peace against War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls on All Koreans to Turn Out in Actions for Peace against War
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The way out for the Koreans at present is to turn out in the nation-wide patriotic, sacred struggle to smash the U.S. moves for confrontation and war against the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Monday.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Korean War was a war of aggression ignited by the U.S. imperialists by instigating the south Korean puppet regime and satellite countries to stifle the DPRK in cradle and realize its wild ambition to dominate the world. It was a war of massacre unprecedented in history.
					
					 In those days the aggressors hell-bent on genocide and destruction shot and burned people to death, buried them alive and hanged them irrespective of age and sex.
					
					 During the war the U.S. man-killers used germ and chemical weapons against the Koreans in violation of international law and even attempted to drop A-bombs.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are escalating the moves to start a new war for realizing their ambition to invade the DPRK, far from drawing a due lesson from their disgraceful defeat in the past Korean War.
					
					 Peace and reunification are the best wishes of the Koreans as they suffered horrible war disasters due to outsiders. 
					
					 The wishes were chilled by the U.S. and its south Korean puppet regime's vicious moves. Prevailing on the Korean Peninsula is such a touch-and-go situation that the second Korean War may break out.
					
					It is as clear as a pikestaff that if the U.S. and its puppet war-like forces are allowed to provoke the war against the DPRK, the north and the south of Korea will never be able to escape another war disaster.
					
					 The prevailing situation calls on all the Koreans at home and abroad to foil these reckless war moves of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges and turn out in the nationwide struggle to achieve the peace and reunification of the country.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Stamping out Pro-Reunification Patriotic Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Stamping Out Pro-Reunification Patriotic Forces
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Now the south Korean puppet regime has reached an extreme phase in suppressing under the pretext of security pro-reunification patriotic forces including the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) struggling for independence, democracy and reunification.
					 The spokesman for the North Headquarters of Pomminryon in its statement on July 1 vehemently branded this crackdown as a criminal action of the puppet regime to totally stamp out the righteous activities of the south headquarters, regarding it as a thorn in its flesh as it has been steadfast in its stand on justice, reunification and patriotism and has played a vanguard role in the struggle for implementing the north-south joint declarations and achieving independent reunification.
					
					 As recognized by the public at home and abroad, the South Headquarters has regarded it as a programme to positively support and implement the three principles -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity -- and the north-south joint declarations and has devotedly worked for their implementation, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is making last-ditch efforts to weather its ruling crisis shaking to its very foundation by diverting elsewhere public criticism through intensified fascist suppression of the South Headquarters and a campaign for eliminating "forces following the north."
					
					 No matter how desperately the puppet regime may try, it can never cover up justice and truth and escape the fate of destruction as it is a treacherous regime going against the public mind-set.
					
					 The road being covered by Pomminryon is a just and patriotic one along which it paves the path of independent reunification together with all other compatriots at home and abroad. No physical crackdown can ever stop its advance.
					
					 The puppet regime should stop at once its fascist suppression of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and unconditionally set free the unreasonably detained pro-reunification figures without delay.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage North-targeted Field Mobile Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage North-targeted Field Mobile Drill
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The 30th Division of the south Korean puppet ground force plans to stage a field mobile drill in Koyang and Yangju, Kyonggi Province from July 3 to 7, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Huge troops and war equipment will reportedly be involved in the drill to fan up war fever.
					
					 This projected reckless saber-rattling is touching off resentment among compatriots.

articles.title: Halt to Moves to Introduce U.S.-made Fighters Demanded
articles.content:
Halt to Moves to Introduce U.S.-made Fighters Demanded 
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification held the 135th rally for peace and disarmament outside the building of the Defence Agency in south Korea on June 28.
					 Speakers at the rally recalled that the agency announced it would finally decide upon the import of U.S.-made fighters at the committee for promoting the defence affair in mid-July.
					
					 The on-going introduction of fighters is an unnecessary military reinforcement and a product of the greed of the U.S. and its munitions complexes to rake up profits by taking advantage of the crisis on the Korean Peninsula, they held, and went on;
					
					 The expenses for the development of F-35s have doubled due to a lot of defects. It is hardly understandable to introduce such type fights.
					
					 They demanded an immediate halt to the introduction of fighters.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Pakistan
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Pakistan
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- A senator affiliated with the Pakistan Awami National Party and the general secretary of the Sind State Committee of the same party sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Islamabad on June 19, the 49th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War Marked Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War was marked in different countries. A meeting took place in Sofia, Bulgaria and lectures were given at Dubreka Art University of Guinea and a university of Brazil from June 20 to 25.
					 The acting chief of the Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia said it was miraculous that the young DPRK defeated the U.S. which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world.
					
					 President Kim Il sung, outstanding strategist, brought about victory in the war with his unique strategy, tactics and war methods, the acting chief noted.
					
					 The dean of the Art Department of the Guinean university said that under the leadership of Kim Il Sung the Korean people defeated the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and defended the freedom and independence of the country, thus shattering the U.S. scenario to put the world under its control with the Korean Peninsula as a springboard.
					
					 The DPRK, who won victories and glory only under the Songun politics of leader Kim Jong Il, is foiling the U.S. imperialists' highhanded and arbitrary practices, demonstrating its might as a nuclear weapons state and a country manufacturing and launching satellite as they are led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, the dean stressed.
					
					 The chairman of the Brazilian committee for remembering Kim Jong Il noted the situatiion proves that the DPRK's nuclear deterrence serves as a treasured sword for defending the peace and the security in the Korean Peninsula and the region, adding that the U.S. is the main culprit of the nuclear crisis on the peninsula.
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Nepali Paper Explains Validity of DPRK's New Strategic Line
articles.content:
Nepali Paper Explains Validity of DPRK's New Strategic Line
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Nepali paper Nepal Today on June 25 carried an article titled "New strategic line." It explained the validity of the line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force laid down in the March, 2013 Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The paper said:
					
					 The new strategic line of the DPRK was prompted by the requirements of the prevailing situation.
					
					 The DPRK's decision to continue bolstering the nuclear force both in quality and quantity was quite natural and a wise option as the U.S., the world's biggest nuclear weapons state, poses extreme nuclear threats to the DPRK.
					
					 The new strategic line is the most realistic one suited to the actual conditions of the country which aims to build a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The era has gone never to return when the U.S. threatened the DPRK with nukes and used to put a brake on its economic construction.
					
					 The world will clearly see how mercilessly the DPRK thwarts the imperialists and their followers' war threat by dint of tremendous nuclear deterrence and builds a thriving socialist nation without fail.

articles.title: U.S. Is Arch Criminal Increasing Tensions on Korean Peninsula: Organizations
articles.content:
U.S. Is Arch Criminal Increasing Tensions on Korean Peninsula: Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Russian and Peruvian organizations released statements and an appeal on June 25 to mark the beginning of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK in a statement denounced the U.S. for igniting the Korean War to stifle the young DPRK and employing the most brutal means and methods.
					
					 The U.S. ceaseless war exercises against the DPRK and its moves for arms buildup clearly show who is the arch criminal screwing up the tensions on the Korean Peninsula, the statement said.
					
					 The Peruvian Committee for Solidarity with Peoples in a statement praised the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung as an invincible and iron-willed commander who led to victory the Fatherland Liberation War with his outstanding strategy and tactics, bringing about the beginning of a downhill turn for the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 It urged the U.S. to make prompt response to the DPRK's proposal for talks and conclude a peace treaty with the latter.
					
					 The Russian Society for Promoting the Study and Dissemination of Comrade Kim Jong Il's Works in an appeal noted that to embody the Songun idea and Songun politics, legacy of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, guarantees genuine freedom and independence of the country and durable peace of the whole world.
					
					 The appeal urged the U.S. to withdraw its troops from south Korea and stop interfering in the internal affairs of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios de canonazos de unidad 851 de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios de canonazos de unidad 851 de EPC
						
Pyongyang, 1 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio los ejercicios de canonazos de la Unidad 851 del EPC.
					Tras recibir por parte del comandante el parte del plan de canonazos y el estado de colocacion de las subunidades de artilleria, el Mariscal dio la orden de iniciar el entrenamiento.
					
					Subrayo que se realizaron los canonazos en la condicion inesperada, pero los artilleros estan preparados para dar blanco certero aun en medio de cualesquier circunstancias como hoy porque intensificaron el entrenamiento al aceptar bien la demanda del Partido de elevar el arte para canonear.
					
					Enseno que lo mas importante para perfeccionar los preparativos de combate es preparar en el tiempo ordinario a todos como artilleros celebres al fortalecer los ejercicios y  presento las tareas programaticas para este fin.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y la conviccion de que ellos daran mas acicates a los preparativos de combate con el unanime deseo de defender fidedignamente la seguridad de la patria y la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					Le acompanaron Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon, Ju To Hyon y Rim Kwang Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia regalos a constructores militares de campo de esqui
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia regalos a constructores militares de campo de esqui
						
Pyongyang, 1 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio los regalos a los constructores militares quienes registran proezas heroicas en la construccion del campo de esqui del monte Masik.
					Con la publicacion del llamamiento historico, el Mariscal les deposito la gran confianza de culminar incondicionalmente la obra dentro de este ano al crear la nueva "velocidad Masikryong", la de ataque del siglo 21 de los combatientes capaces de aniquilar uno contra cien enemigos y esta vez les hizo llegar muchos materiales de construccion, alimentos y articulos de primera necesidad.
					
					Tuvo lugar este lunes en el terreno la ceremonia de entrega.

articles.title: CRPP rechaza palabras de Park Geun-hye dichas en visita a China
articles.content:
CRPP rechaza palabras de Park Geun-hye dichas en visita a China
						
Pyongyang, 1 de julio (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de la ACNC formulada el dia primero en relacion con que durante su visita a China, la mandataria surcoreana pronuncio palabras provocativas a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el vocero del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) dio la siguiente respuesta:
					Durante su visita a China, Park Geun-hye dijo unas palabras provocativas que insultaron seriamente la dignidad y el regimen de la RPDC.
					
					En la "cumbre", entrevistas y ruedas de prensa y conferencia especial impartida en una universidad, ella cuestiono obstinadamente el "problema nuclear del Norte" expresando "preocupacion" e "inaceptabilidad" y calumnio la linea de desarrollo paralelo de la RPDC como "cosa imposible" y "camino que busca el aislamiento propio".
					
					Ademas, al describir el arma nuclear de la RPDC como amenaza para la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y el Nordeste Asiatico, senalo que "(el Norte) debe abandonar ese artefacto y hacerse un miembro responsable de la sociedad internacional" y mendigo el apoyo en el asunto de "fugitivos norcoreanos".
					
					Resultaron repugnantes el cinismo y la postura miserable con que Park trato de buscar el apoyo a su camarilla.
					
					Es bien conocido que el problema nuclear fue causado por Estados Unidos y la amenaza nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana proviene de ese imperio y el Sur de Corea.
					
					A decir verdad, es precisamente el Sur de Corea el que introdujo en su territorio los medios estrategicos nucleares de EE.UU. y lanza demencialmente la inusitada campana de guerra nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					Sin embargo, sin hacer referencia alguna al armamento nuclear agresivo de EE.UU., dice con la logica de bandido que es "inaceptable" el escudo nuclear de justicia de la connacional RPDC. 
					
					Lo mas grave del caso es que a pesar de las repetidas advertencias, Park censuro otra vez en su estancia en China la linea de la RPDC de impulsar simultaneamente la construccion economica y la de fuerzas armadas nucleares.
					
					Esto constituye un desafio frontal a la dignidad, el regimen y la linea politica de la RPDC y una provocacion nunca tolerable.
					
					Esa linea es la orientacion mas independiente y patriotica para fortalecer las fuerzas armadas nucleares, de modo que se consolide en todos los aspectos la defensa nacional, se garanticen la seguridad y prosperidad de la nacion y se de mayor impulso a la construccion economica con la meta de construir un Estado prospero donde los habitantes puedan vivir en opulencias en el sistema socialista.
					
					La acusacion de Park es para recurrir a toda costa a la confrontacion y las maniobras de agresion contra la RPDC al ver que el poderio y el prestigio de la RPDC han llegado al climax y las maniobras de guerra nuclear de EE.UU. se encuentran en la crisis de fracaso. 
					
					Esta vez, Park parloteo otra vez del "cambio" diciendo sobre las "nuevas relaciones entre el Sur y el Norte de Corea" y "nueva Peninsula Coreana", pero, el que debe cambiarse primero es el "poder" del Sur de Corea.
					
					Lo prueba el hecho de que en el Sur de Corea se alzan las voces de calificar el "poder" de Park de un poder mas conflictivo que el de Lee Myung Bak.
					
					Para tomar el poder, el "poder" de Park instigo al Servicio de Inteligencia a intervenir en las "elecciones presidenciales" y dio a la publicidad la nota del dialogo de la Cumbre Norte-Sur de Corea en que ni el traidor Lee Myung Bak se atrevio a pensar, de manera que reinara caos en el interior del Sur de Corea y se sacudiera de raiz el sistema de gobernacion.
					
					A pesar de esto, Park dijo cinicamente que "lo que pienso al hacer la politica es la confianza" y "la diplomacia esta basada tambien en la confianza".
					
					Y al decir del "proceso de confianza de la Peninsula Coreana" insistio en que bajo cualesquier condiciones, es intolerable la posesion de armas nucleares del Norte, hara rotundo frente a su "provocacion" y ayudara al Norte si este toma el camino de cambio.
					
					Con tales peroratas puso al desnudo que el "proceso de confianza" tomado por ella como su "politica sobre el Norte" es una politica conflictiva y peligrosa igual a "la desnuclearizacion, la apertura y 3 000 dolares" de la banda de Lee Myung Bak.
					
					En una palabra, la intencion de Park es desarmarnos con las fuerzas foraneas y cambiar nuestro regimen a traves de las cooperaciones internacionales anti-RPDC, lo que es una ilusion irrealizable.
					
					Por su procedimiento conflictivo, la mandataria surcoreana recibio un consejo de que "tuviera una buena alma".
					
					Ella debe saber claramente que no podra ser objeto de regateo nuestra arma nuclear, considerada como escudo para la justicia y la paz y tesoro nacional por mas que picotee tanto la sirvienta de guerra de EE.UU.
					
					Nuestro ejercito y pueblo no perdonaran jamas a quienes recurran a la confrontacion fratricida burlandose atrevidamente de nuestra dignidad.
					
					En la actualidad, observamos a Park con la ultima paciencia.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas desean de veras el dialogo entre el Norte y el Sur y la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas, deben poner fin a los actos conflictivos inutiles inclusive el servilismo a EE.UU. y la confrontacion fratricida y tomar la posicion nacional botando las palabrerias conflictivas.
					
					Esto es una correcta opcion para las relaciones intercoreanas y para si misma.

articles.title: Premier coreano visita Complejo Termoelectrico de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Premier coreano visita Complejo Termoelectrico de Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 1 de julio (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, visito el Complejo Termoelectrico de Pyongyang.
					Recorriendo varios puntos del complejo, el premier felicito mucho los exitos alcanzados por los funcionarios y obreros en acato al llamamiento del partido y se entero de la produccion electrica y el estado de funcionamiento de caldera.
					
					En la reunion de consulta convocada en el terreno destaco la necesidad de generar mucho mas la electricidad y suministrarla a varias ramas de la economia nacional de acuerdo con la demanda de la construccion de la potencia economica y de ampliar los exitos de produccion al organizar bien la administracion de equipos y tecnica y apoyar en la ciencia y tecnica.
					
					Con posterioridad, el premier recorrio la Granja Cooperativa de Miphyong del distrito Tongchon de la provincia de Kangwon, ocasion en la cual hizo conocimiento del estado de abonamiento y cuidado de cultivos y acentuo la necesidad de establecer el sistema de produccion circular para elevar la fertilidad de tierra cultivable e incrementar la produccion de cereales, asi como de prevenir los danos de cereales y tierra debidos a la lluvia torrencial.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier realizo la visita a la Compania Mixta Ltd. de Equipos Electricos de Pyongyang, en que se cercioro del estado de investigacion sobre las ramas de la administracion electrica y de la produccion de contadores de electricidad de diversa utilidad.
					
					En la reunion consultiva sostenida en el terreno, se debatieron los temas sobre las medidas para mejorar el sistema de la industria electrica segun la elevada demanda en la economia nacional y utilizar eficientemente la electricidad.
